Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Nortek Inc. agreed to pay $291,403 in disgorgement plus $30,655 in interest to resolve allegations concerning $290,000 in improper payments and gifts made to Chinese officials by a Nortek subsidiary in order to receive preferential treatment, relaxed regulatory oversight, or reduced customs duties, taxes, and fees.  These included cash payments, gift cards, meals, travel, accommodations, and entertainment.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/pressrelease/2016-109.html
Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: Bard Manufacturing Company, Inc.; Burnham Holdings, Inc.; Carrier Corporation; Chromalox; Crane; Climate Master, Inc.; Empire Comfort Systems; General Electric Company; Honeywell International Inc.; Hunter Fan Company; Invensys, Inc.; ITT Corporation; Johnson Controls; Lear Siegler; Lennox International Inc.; Lux Products; The Marley-Wylain Company; Nortek Global HVAC, LLC; Sears Holdings; Thomas & Betts Corporation; Trane Residential Systems; Uponor, Inc.; Vaillant Corporation; W. W. Grainger; and  White-Rodgers agreed to jointly pay a total of $625,000 in settlement of allegations the companies failed to meet requirements to collect out of service mercury-added thermostats required by the state Health and Safety Code.
Agency: California Department of Toxic Substances Control
Info Source: https://dtsc.ca.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/31/2018/01/Mercury_ConsentOrder021016.pdf
